author: {'steamid': '76561198118213076', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1484963266}
review: Disturbed es una novela visual de aventura y puzzles con escenarios terroríficos dibujados a mano y si bien no son muy detallados logra conseguir una atmosfera depresiva. Somos un granjero llamado Von que despierta en un mundo lleno de oscuridad y sin esperanzas, debemos embarcarnos en la aventura y descubrir cómo cambiar esta situación. Es un juego corto pero gratuito que sinceramente jugué por los logros y está parte me pareció un poco tediosa porque si quieres desbloquearlos todos debes acceder a todos los caminos que mayormente te llevan a la muerte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312196006', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 638, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1588246781}
review: Прикольная игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966174472', 'num_games_owned': 1146, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1587941730}
review:
Muermo no, lo siguiente, con premisas como "Crea tu propia aventura" o "las elecciones importan" me la han intentado colar pero no han podido, nos encontramos ante un juego para textualmente, perder el tiempo. Disturbed es un juego harto lineal que posee pues, una historia muy forzada y sesgada, pillada con pinzas, solo tiene desencadenantes y no una historia como tal en donde los logros los vas consiguiendo cada vez que haces las cosas "mal", básicamente, mueres, y que no puedes saltarte los pasos, me refiero, para conseguir algo siempre tienes que conseguir el paso anterior, eso sí, se te lo saltaste, vas tener que retroceder por 20 escenarios para hacer un mero tramite, y para colmo, cada vez que mueres, el juego se reinicia hasta haber nacido de nuevo y tienes que volver a seleccionar hasta el idioma, lo raro es que no se haya desinstalado de lo pésimo que es. Me ha parecido muy aburrido, no se ni lo que he pagado por este juego pero seguro que fue demasiado, aunque fueran un par de céntimos.

Mi recomendación, si lo encuentras gratuito o quieres llenar tu vitrina de otro juego polvoriento al que no jugaras o que lo pasarás solo por los logros, este es tu juego. Si no, hay opciones mucho mejores en el catálogo de Steam en este mismo formato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080291518', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1587476968}
review:
Oui, pour les amateurs de jeux narratifs type livre dont vous êtes le  héros, qui rêvent d'un jeu ou il faut savegarder à tous les tableaux, et qui  aiment les succès constitués des différentes morts qui arrivent au protagoniste. 

Le jeu est plus une aventure narrative qu'un jeu. Il est dans la lignée des textuals games des années 80 ou c'était les lignes de texte qui faisaient vibrer nos ptis coeurs en mousse.  Les graphismes sont chouettes. 

MAIS. 

C'est chiant. On passe son temps à recommencer, se perdre, ne pas comprendre la logique et les interactions sont... euh... bah... pas là. 
Le perso n'a pas de stuff, ne peux pas s'en procurer, et c'est toute la différence avec un jeu d'aventure. 
Le côté " exploration des aspects sombre de l'angoisse et de la dépression" euh, je le cherche encore. On croise une licorne, un ours, un chariot, un... bref. 

Il est gratuit, testez le, c'est une expérience, et c'est possiblement plaisant pour certains, et c'est pour ça que je ne le recommande pas pas ( krkrkr) mais franchement, je pense qu'il existe des expériences similaires très largements supérieures. 

La traduction française est passable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198374382397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1517548869}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268400506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1586848979}
review:
Really fun and interesting visual novel. 17 different endings and most of them are pretty funny/morbid. There is a supernatural plague at force in the game and it's your job to figure out how to stop it. It's ominous, but nothing terrifying; anyone over 10 could handle the subject matter. The deaths in game aren't explicitly shown and usually have a funny caption along with them. It goes to show the game doesn't take itself too seriously in the horror department, which makes it fun to play casually. 
Disturbed is a neat short story here with a lot of thought into all the possible paths a person could take. The hand drawn scenes are awesome, the music in the game is nice, and its FREE! You just can't beat that. Took me about an hour and ten minutes to 100% the achievements. Absolutely worth checking out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198274530592', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1483750512}
review:
Nice short game.
Well drawn and a bit atmospheric.
It's a free game and if you like short games and light novels you'll like it.
I'm not particulary found of light novels but I really enjoyed this one.
The history is poetically written.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243796752', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1587516913}
review: This is not the Dark Souls of text games. its just a text game that has no real end in sight and you just kinda have to figure it out on your own. HOWEVER, it does have an interesting set of encounters and things to find that kept me entertained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422485676', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1695741968}
review: Игра представляет из себя довольно разветвлённую новеллу с большим количеством выборов (хотя большинство из них ведут к смерти главного героя), а также элементами квеста (некоторые места можно пройти только в том случае, если в наличии есть необходимый предмет, который можно найти на определённой локации). Графическая часть выполнена хорошо, не хватает только какого-то атмосферного эмбиента на фоне. В целом, довольно неплохая новелла на вечер. Можно пройти за час, максимум за два.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262663561', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1602985349}
review: Крайне интересный опыт. Визуальная новелла а играется как квест, при том что все время на тебя действует своеобразная атмосфера страха, непонятности и отвращения(от сюжетных мест, а не от игры). Рекомендую ли я? скажу лишь то что, почему бы и нет, игра проходится на 100% довольно быстро, опыт интересный, проект стоит вашего внимания.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007787000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1585438904}
review:
Death is lurking every corner, every page, every click... and all left to you is... guessing.

I seen it a billion times before. It is basically a linear story masked as if a branching-story by giving player some options to click. There are only three possible results: Continue the story (the only plot avaiable, actually), have something pointless (contributing very little to the mood and giving the player absolutely no information about the game, setting, story or whatever) or just... die. Nice way of solving the problem of adding options for the player click on.

The Interactive Fiction community is full of it. There is a lot of wonderful programmers or talented designers who wants making a game. However, they use lacking the skill of a story teller. This is the resul. You end with a fake interactive fiction poorly delivering a story, where the real game is just taking notes and map where to click to not die.

Even the Horror theme wents melting down in this mess. First, because it is over-used, as a "scary pictures" pops-up all the time. Second, because there is no narrative line long and deep enough to build up tension. 

Character is vague, reasons are vague, objectives are vague. A vague game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317860023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1585262257}
review: What a fun game. This 100% choose your own adventure like the old school books. Yes, you have to back track, A LOT. But there are things you can actually just figure out so I felt the balance was enough to keep me going. Illustrations were nicely dim, I liked the kind of animation that was bordering on goofy but it just continued the vibe. Music and sound effects were appropriately sparing. Had legitimate "yay!", "aww, man", "take that!" throughout. This is a very fun game. If you're looking for nonstop guns blazing high graphics just go away now. Or try it, you just might like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418261627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1584956881}
review:
[h1]¡No dejes que mi sacrificio sea en vano! [/h1]

[i]Este tipo de juegos de horror en los que tienes que tomar decisiones me encantan. "Disturbed" no fue la excepción, tiene una historia simple pero entretenida, te genera esa sensación de no querer parar hasta exprimirle todo el jugo. 
El juego tiene 2 finales, uno "malo" y otro bueno, personalmente me gustó más el malo, porque los finales agridulces me pueden.
Les recomiendo que guarden todo el tiempo, para que les sea más fácil conseguir todos los logros o en caso de que mueran (que van a ser bastantes veces), no tener que empezar desde un punto muy alejado al que se quedaron.

La única crítica negativa que voy a dar y que espero que arreglen, es que el idioma no se matiene fijo. Cada vez que sales a la pantalla de inicio, o cargas un nueva partida después de morir, el idioma vuelve a ponerse en ingles. Y la verdad es un poco molesto tener que estar modificando el idioma una y otra vez. Llegó un punto que me cansé y lo dejé en ingles, total puedo entenderlo perfecto. Pero estaría bueno que arreglaran ese detallito.

 Si estas aburrido y quieres algo corto pero atrapante, este juego es perfecto para ti.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561199021671491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1647990650}
review: A little spooky choose-your-own adventure. Lots of creative choices. Short & sweet but a fun ride if you like puzzles. The tunnel maze was a bit frustrating but I was able to figure it out after looking up the guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992484932', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1583039802}
review: Let me say something right now. Unless you wanna spend at least over 15 hours in this game completing it to the fullest with the achievements, it's best to get a guide, especially for the last two achievements, because they're craaaaaazy long. This is basically a trial and error game where you are going on a ton of adventures. The graphics are pretty cool, there is just not thaaaat much action, it's more of a visual novel game more than anything. Great game to get achievements for freeeeee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198423467246', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1582929281}
review: Bei Disturbed handelt es sich um eine tolle kleine Mischung aus Visual Novel und Point & Click Adventure. An jedem Ort wird man gefragt, ob man beispielsweise den linken oder rechten Weg einschlagen möchte. Manchmal gibt es auch etwas zu entdecken und man erhält dabei wichtige Gegenstände, um die Geschichte voranzutreiben. Generell trifft man somit kontinuierlich Entscheidungen. Die meisten davon führen allerdings zu einem sofortigen und amüsanten Tod. Aufgrund dieser zahlreichen Sackgassen ist die eigentliche Handlung, welche man bis zum Ende spielen kann, sehr linear. Es gilt also herauszufinden, welcher Weg der richtige ist und in welcher Reihenfolge man irgendwann die Orte besuchen muss. Nichtsdestotrotz existieren zwei unterschiedliche Enden, die man erreichen kann. Die Handlung mag zwar belanglos sein, doch dank des Spielprinzips hatte ich viel Spaß mit Disturbed. Die dazugehörigen Bilder und die Musik waren sehr schlicht, aber ohne Zweifel stimmig. Für Zwischendurch einfach perfekt!

review:
I recommend it for the art, mood, and huge choice. 

But the game doesn't follow logic - there's really only 2 ways to win, and the choices you make to get there you probably wouldn't be able to figure out yourself. A lot of going back and forth and doing the opposite of what you think you should do.

Love the death scenes though. Do read the story. 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060155627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1581945911}
review:
It's a cool point-and-click with a spooky atmosphere. I'd argue that the story is bland and generic, but hey, the game is free so you can't really criticize it too harshly. It was made using RPG maker or something like that, and it's a very creative use of a game engine in my opinion. It's a quite cool game, it's free, and if you're often bored like me I'd recommend you this to check out when you're bored.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040954651', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1579451297}
review:
I've seen this game described as being like the "Choose your own adventure" novels I remember from my childhood.  I have also seen it described as the Dark Souls of visual novels.  Both of these descriptions are pretty accurate.

You play as a farmer who wakes up to a dystopian medieval nightmare; a world where anything and everything will kill you in the blink of an eye.  And it does.  Repeatedly.
Despite this, I never found myself getting frustrated with having to restart the game and work my way back through it (the save feature is for wimps!).  The story was intriguing enough that I found myself focusing on resolving it, rather than screaming "BS" at my screen every time I died.

Definitely worth a play if masochism is your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976452525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1572417816}
review:
If this review were anything like the game, you would have died four times before the end of this sentence.

It's not as bad as it sounds, though.  In fact, it helps set the perfect mood at the beginning.  This thing opens in a really dark place.  You're a nameless farmer whose entire world is decaying around him, body and soul, through the poisonous attack of some mysterious dark pestilence.  So like a boss he decides to go do something about it.

That little description doesn't do justice to the surprising vividness with which it's portrayed.  I'm not kidding.  This blighted world practically seeps right out of your screen in a cloud of noxious vapor.

The minimalist black-and-white drawings might not look like much at first glance, but add some nice lighting and fog, ominous music and crisp sound effects and they really come to life.  They remind me of this book of horror stories that everybody had when we were kids.  You know, that one with the picture of the corpse woman that scared the hell out of every child in America.

The game itself is sort of a hybrid.  Not really a point-and-click, even though you do interact with objects and solve a few little puzzles; and despite being driven mostly by text-based decisions it's not quite a choose-your-own-adventure either, since there's a good bit of non-linear exploration to be done.
  
What really stood out, though--and I wasn't expecting this at all--was the emotional arc that the game follows.
  
To say that you start off in pretty dire straits is an understatement.  They sketch a portrait of a thoroughly beaten man who's about T-minus half a day from just lying down in weary defeat and withering away to dust with everything else.  The writing here is simple but its flat, gray tone is very effective in conveying a state of mind beyond even desperation, to the point where you can feel real despair.  It's kind of scary, in fact; and in a game with no other living people to defeat or save that actually created a surprising amount of motivation all on its own.
  
Maybe it's divine intervention, or maybe he summons the will to fight from some last, hidden well of inner strength; but he takes a step, and then another.  And as the player at first it all seems futile; everywhere you turn you find only death.  At some point, though, you see a little success and it sparks a glimmer of hope.  Before you know it you settle into an adventure which carries you through to the end.  When you finally triumph, you feel a sense not only of victory, but almost of purification, like you clawed you way out the vilest swamp imaginable into the sunlight of a spring morning.

That's how it felt to me, at least.  Pretty compelling stuff.

As epilogue to all this, I finally read the whole store descripion after finishing it.  The author claims it was "inspired by experiences of depression and addiction," and I believe him.  It definitely carries a certain weight that seems to propel it beyond mere plot into the realm of allegory.

Maybe I should have known that ahead of time, but what can I say. When I see "free" it's download first and ask questions later. 



You can find more indie game reviews at [url=https://oddlittlegames.com] oddlittlegames.com [/url] or visit my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34514756/] curator page. [/url]  Thanks, and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092611902', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1574783164}
review:
Grüße^^

Eine Freundin hat mir dieses Spiel empfohlen als sie bei mir war. Also hab ich, mir nichts dir nichts, das Spiel heruntergeladen und es gestartet. Ich muss mich echt bei ihr bedanken ! :3

Das Spiel hat mich gute 2 Stunden eingefangen.
Hier also ein bisschen was zum Spiel:

Erzählt wird die eigene spanende Reise selbst.
Man steht vor Entscheidungen und man trifft eine Wahl.
Jede Entscheidung kann das Ende sein. 
Zusätzlich ist das Abenteuer mit kleinen kniffligen Rätseln gespickt. 
Bei dem ein oder anderem Rätsel musste man auch zweimal nachdenken um auf die Lösung zu kommen.
Alles in allem aber ein fantastisches kleines Spiel. ^-^

Mir persönlich hat es so gut gefallen das ich mir das DLC gleich danach gekauft habe.
Dankeschön an den Entwickler und an meine Freundin ! c(*-*c)

Liebe Grüße, Esteriefeya

author: {'steamid': '76561198171718019', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1538245017}
review:
[h1]Disturbed[/h1]


Muy buen juego, aventura interesante y ademas es gratis. No me suelen gustar mucho las "novelas visuales", pero este me llamo la atención en cuanto lo mire, aparte de que es de terror. Somos un granjero (si no mal recuerdo) en el cual debemos tomar decisiones y buenos caminos para sobrevivir y averiguar que demonios esta pasando, lo que esta chido del juego, es que debes escoger bien tus decisiones, porque puedes morir de distintas formas y tiene finales alternativos. Esta bien el juego, digo para matar el tiempo jugandolo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061364654', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1572653019}
review:
I downloaded and completed Disturbed to support the developer's goal of raising awareness about depression and mental illness.  

It is a simply constructed narrative, but effective at conveying the difficulty of overcoming dark moods, depression and feelings of hopelessness.  There are lots of ways to die quickly, and only one correct path.  1 to 2 hours of simple, linear puzzling for completion.

The gameplay is nothing new or groundbreaking, but the art is stylish, appropriate and hand-drawn. The developer is to be commended for tackling a difficult emotional theme, and for publishing the game for free as a public service.

author: {'steamid': '76561198974489722', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1573986209}
review: DISTURBED это очень крутое приключение на полтора часа. Игра затягивает не сюжетом и сложными головоломками, или же нелинейностью (тут напротив всё очень линейно), она затягивает атмосферой, что честно сказать тут просто неповторима. Из подобных игр в душу запала только эта, с нетерпением жду продолжения хуй

author: {'steamid': '76561198267043682', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1568201213}
review:
[h1][b] «Disturbed – Ужасы, сокрытые в темноте» [/b][/h1]
[b][u] [Из рубрики «Без спойлерофф!!!»] [/u][/b]

Приветствую всех, кто читает данный обзор. Сегодня я бы хотел поговорить о такой мрачной и непредсказуемой игре, как Disturbed. На первый взгляд обычная, рисованная, ничем непримечательная новелла, однако, что-то всё же в ней есть. Что-то цепляющееся, что проносится через всю игру вместе с Вами. Любой, кто начнёт играть в эту игру, будет задаваться логичными вопросами: «Что меня ждёт впереди?» «Что есть начало конца?» «Зачем я это делаю?». Не стоит спешить, ведь на все эти и последующие Ваши вопросы ответит эта игра.

[h1][b]Концепция[/b][/h1]
С самого начала Вам дают понять, что Вы - обычный фермер. Совершенно небогатый, всего одна корова и растения, которые Вы бережно выращиваете на протяжении нескольких лет на практически мёртвой земле. Вы фермер, который со стороны наблюдает за тем, как разносится чума, которая ведёт к многочисленным смертям. То, что Вы станете ещё одной жертвой  - не может подлежать сомнениям. Есть ли вообще разница в том, как Вы погибнете? Что Вы, обычный фермер, можете сделать? Ничего? Или всё же можете? Старайтесь выкручиваться из самых ужасных ситуаций, путём грамотного обдумывания ситуаций, взвешивая все «За!» и «Против!» и, наконец, принимая окончательные решения, от которых будет зависеть Ваша судьба.
Игра наполнена головоломками, Вам придётся искать нужные для прохождения предметы, которые раскиданы по всем локациям. В зависимости от того, что Вы смогли найти и приберечь у себя, можно попасть совсем на другую развилку событий. Думайте головой, прежде чем куда-либо пойти и что-либо сделать. В каждом, абсолютно в каждом предмете есть свой, пускай и малый, но скрытый и смертельно опасный подвох.

[h1][b][9.5/10][/b][/h1]
Однозначно рекомендую. Игра мне пришлась по душе: два с лишним часа мрачнейшего геймплея просто не могут не радовать, атмосферная визуальная новелла, приятно нарисованная и вселяющая страх при каждом неверном шаге. Если проникнуться всем, что происходит в игре – может не по хилому кошмарить. Да, есть мелкие недочёты и несостыковки, но в основном игра хороша. Будьте внимательны и осторожны - неправильное действие может привести к непредвиденным последствиям.

[h1][b][code]Умрёте Вы или достигните истинного своего предназначения? Старайтесь, пробуйте. Не получилось? – пробуйте снова. Я верю в Вас. [/code][/b][/h1]
[code] Понравился обзор? Тогда скорее подпишись на мою группу-куратора [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ReviewsTime] [u]Reviews Time![/u] [/url], чтобы не пропускать новые рецензии на интересные игры! [/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032487588', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1566922351}
review:
Disturbed is a casual, exploratory, and atmospheric game that is worth your time.  Of course, no cost.  It's essentially linear and text based.  There are no jump scares.  The strategy is largely built on fetch quests, which I personally enjoy, if taken in moderation.  No Steam cards.  No dexterity required.  

1. GRAPHICS: The b/w graphics on the Steam Store page are representative.  If you're looking for eye candy, look elsewhere.  Personally, I kinda liked it.   The graphics complemented the atmosphere.

2. ACHIEVEMENTS: Some have complained that the 17 achievements are mostly death related. However, I would consider the achievements a "reward" for your death, a way that compensates you for a failed strategy.  That encourages exploration and trial/error. 

3. REPLAY VALUE: Absolutely none -- because in playing the game, you learn the choices.  Now that I've finished, I plan to uninstall it.   It's a great one-and-done for probably one 1-2 hour session.

4. FINAL COMMENTS: Save, save, save.  -- but DON'T use the autosave.  Note that making progress in one area before another area may prevent either getting a death achievement (in other words, correctly acquiring an appropriate object will ensure that you survive/succeed).  Plus, you won't experience the alternative ending.  There are more save slots that you can populate.  --  Don't you want to backtrack just a little rather than start the whole game over?

author: {'steamid': '76561198944788453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1566848015}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004204403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1566487040}
review:
Atmosfera ben riuscita per questa cupa avventura testuale fantasy con disegni a matita molto sporchi e graffianti.

Piacevole da giocare e non troppo banale; differenti morti si celano dietro la scelta sbagliata come l'originario genere degli anni 80 al quale Disturbed si ispira. 

Si può completare in un'oretta, più complicato ottenere tutti i 17 differenti finali (che sarebbero poi gli achievements).

Se per voi la grafica non è tutto, giocatela!

author: {'steamid': '76561198238958640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1558792735}
review:
Единственная причина, по которой в это играет здоровый адекватный человек - он очень хочет поднять рейтинг ачивок в Стиме. ОЧЕНЬ хочет. И скорее всего говноед.
Вот и я захотел померятся с другом числами, поэтому игры с 100% открытых достижений очень были нужны.
Эта, с позволения сказать, игра, про то, как ты полчаса тыкаешь по кнопкам, умирая от разных неочевидных вещей, одновременно умирая от скуки. Грёбаная визуальная новелла на змеином движке, бессмысленная и беспощадная. Через полчаса ты открываешь гайд на 100% и добиваешься всех смертей и двух одинаковых концовок. Игра пройдена, можно удалять. Задуматься о вечном она не заставит, простого человеческого фана не принесёт. Как рефанднуть время, потраченное на неё?

Оценка: 12 кончиков пальцев/10 оторванных конечностей

author: {'steamid': '76561198127191921', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1561821005}
review:
First of all, what I liked about the game is that it reminds me of the Choose Your Own Adventure series of books I read a few years ago. Each action could lead you to your death which puts you back to the beginning to continue another adventure. The game is in a fantasy world where a plague is destroying the land, you are a farmer who is going to save the land. The game is dark, and the pictures are drawn black and white in creepy yet beautiful sketches which reflects on the dark themes of the game. I like the multiple endings which some I had to look up a guide, the easy achievements which every ending gives. 

If you ever read and loved the Choose Your Own Adventure books when you were younger, like visual novels, dark atmospheres, short games, and easy achievements. This game is for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131242035', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1562672166}
review: 설정을 파 보기도 전에 온갖 이유로 죽는, 거의 돌연사 게임입니다. TRPG 시나리오였다면 설정과 소재도 살리고 훨씬 즐겁게 플레이할 수 있었을 것 같은데 이렇게 돼 있으니까 뭔가 지겨워서 중간에 내렸네요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060646782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1562688295}
review:
Если рассматривать эту игру как страшную сказку в духе Братьев Гримм, то получилось довольно средне. Ни внятной истории, ни описания мира, ничего.
Плюсы этой новеллы: она бесплатна(ХАЛЯВА!!!), достижения даже без чтения руководства путём логики выбиваются минут за 30, да ещё густая и мрачная атмосфера.
По атмосфере очень напомнило безысходность и безнадёгу игры Betrayer.

Если бы эта "игра" продавалась за деньги, то больше 30 рублей я бы за неё не заплатил. Ну а так за бесплатную халяву скажу только спасибо.

10 симуляторов смерти из 10.
10 сгнивших посевов из 10.

Игра для [strike]ачивкодрочеров[/strike] уважаемых геймеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078463024', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1558780485}
review:
It's pretty good, for a free choose your own adventure.
The graphics, or still images rather, are charming in their own way. Don't expect to see minutely detailed full colour sets, but don't expect a quick MS paint job either. A somewhat repetative kind of CYOA, but then that's the beauty of these games I think, each time you die you learn a little more and progress further next time. 
Worth a couple of plays, it's free so you've nothing to lose.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102136663', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1561360327}
review:
A Choose Your Own Adventure game in a rather bleak setting. The atmosphere and mood are represented well by the art and the fact that basically everything can kill you.

There isn't much music, but especially the main menu theme is very interesting. The longer you listen to it, the more it changes, with the occasional seemingly random (yet somehow not discordant) note finding its way into the melody. I'm pointing this out because it caught my attention only when I tabbed out of the main menu and had it playing in the background; otherwise I wouldn't have noticed since there's not much reason to sit in a main menu for longer than it takes to click somewhere.

That aside, it's a good little game/adventure/VN/whatever you want to call it. The art is kind of rough which fits with the themes of it. There's a surprising amount of choices to make, and a somewhat surprising amount of deaths; you definitely have to play through different paths and figure out how to reach the endings that don't kill you, especially because some actions require items which you will find later.
I'll be honest, I used a guide after getting killed a few times, but I'm lazy, and it's possible to figure all these things out through observation and persistence - though this also involves quite a bit of back and forth in some cases which is less appealing.
Often times I also got killed by making decisions I [i]knew[/i] would get me killed, just to see how it would go down.

The story itself isn't particularly special, but there are some surprises. The frequent deaths didn't feel frustrating to me and even in case one forgets to save the game, it doesn't take long to get back to basically anywhere.

"Free" doesn't always deserve a recommendation, but in this case it does.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099618091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1561470064}
review: По сути я эту игру так и не прошёл, а всё из за того, что на прохождение времени свободного не хватило, а второй раз в неё заходить не особо хочется. Мрачная атмосфера, хороший звук, заставляют погрузиться в настоящий депресняк. Практический каждое ваше действие приводит к смерти, за которые вы получаете достижения. По началу интересно, но потом надоело. Головоломку, только одну видел, про дерево, но и то так себе вроде должна быть. Больше походит на текстовые квесты, где нужно представлять, что и как, но тут вам дают неплохо нарисованные образы, чтобы свести до минимума работу вашего воображения.  Думаю, что кого-то заинтересует игра, так как в принципе она не плоха. Просто не под настроение она мне пришлась.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050016554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1560705181}
review:
Disturbed est un genre de livre dont vous êtes le héros illustré en crayonné gris avec une ambiance réussie, qui nous propose une histoire de désolation avec plein de morts possibles. L'intérêt est d'explorer ces façons de mourir jusqu'à trouver la lumière au bout de ce périple bien sombre. Au début j'étais un peu réticent, c'était style mort directe sur le mauvais choix et ce choix était assez évident. Heureusement, passé le premier tiers, on arrive dans une zone où les choix sont plus subtils et on peut faire pas mal de chose avant de mourir sans forcèment l'avoir vu venir. Je suis content de m'être accroché.

Le truc pénible, le jeu se remettait en anglais à chaque rechargement. Bien lourd pour un jeu dont le principe est de mourir toute les 30 secondes si comme moi, on veut tout voir. Pas compris comment rester durablement en français et au vu du forum, je ne suis pas le seul. Du coup j'en ai eu marre et je l'ai fait en anglais.

Presque 2h sur une histoire qui se bonifie en avançant, malgré ce souci de VF volatile, j'en garderai le souvenir d'un bon petit gratuit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024806132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1560578163}
review:
"despair" would probably be a better title. The deaths in this adventure game are so frequent that the beginning feels claustrophobic.

Yes the deaths are deserved in a way, but I like the feeling of options. I also really enjoy not having 20 clicks before any meaningful decision is made, meaning each death results in tedium and a stretched memory.

Neat idea and atmosphere though. Art can't hold up to it. But its a neat idea.

This may seem ungrateful because its free, but even if its free, why would you play something just to get bored and frustrated?

author: {'steamid': '76561197972330729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 362, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1556466714}
review: A very good choose your own adventure in the classic style, in which there are few correct choices and many, many deaths. Efficient text and easy loading/saving make it painless and entertaining to explore all the grisly outcomes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198517386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1560071924}
review:
Disturbed is a short, text-driven adventure set in a desolate world stricken by a blight of unknown origin. You begin on your farm, seeing your crops die around you. You have two choices: wallow in despair or eliminate the despair spread across the entire land.

This game is definitely worth checking out. It's short and it doesn't take a whole lot of space on your computer. Give it a shot. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253492927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1557337048}
review: Disturbed est une petite histoire visuelle se déroulant dans un moyen-âge ravagé par un fléau, avec quelques touches de surnaturel et d’horreur. L’ambiance du jeu, légèrement angoissante, est renforcée par des sons travaillés ainsi que par de beaux graphismes, faits à la main avec un style crayon à papier. Le scénario, plutôt classique, est plaisant à suivre, avec des choix à faire permettant soit de progresser, soit de trépasser. Disponible en français via les options, le jeu se remet en anglais à chaque nouvelle partie, contrairement au reste des options qui ne se réinitialise pas. Concernant la durée de vie, le jeu est court (environ une heure pour le terminer à 100%) et plutôt facile. A noter enfin que Disturbed est un jeu gratuit, et qu’il est possible de soutenir son développeur via l’achat du DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056888486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1557279599}
review:
This is an ok game all in all, but i just don't feel the ''Chill'' down my spine, i (personally) feel like all the deaths is too predictable, as well as the fact that you die from basically everything.

I know i didn't play much, but there wasn't much in the game to keep me there.

I will say tho, it really does have a charm of it's own.

The things i would practice more.
1. Story Branching
2. Jumpscares
3. Sound Effects
4. Shadows
5. Writing

Story Branching - There isn't really much that let's me ''Choose'' mostly because the choices i do make end up not really affecting anything, also, you die, A LOT.

Jumpscares - i can't for sure tell you the jumpscares are bad, because i didn't play much of this game, so i don't know if the jumpscares get better, but from what i DID play, the jumpscares are just images blurring into vision. i'd say, give it a small amount of animation, and some sudden screeches or growls.

Sound Effects - The ones that can be heard are fairly good samples, but it needs more variation, Randomize the door sounds and maybe some sounds the let's you know  that something is further ahead, also use some panning on some of the sounds relevant to the side it's coming from.

Shadows - Not much to say, but more detailed shadows, also maybe mix it up, maybe let the statues move sometimes, but only a little, to give the feeling that ''Something is different''

Writing - It's fairly ok, but maybe change the text's for when you move back on your adventure, something like ''You came to the conclusion that you couldn't do much there, and walked back, thinking of your next move you decide to''
give it some variation, and let people know that everything that one does, is actually noticed.
It's the details.

But all in all i'd say it's an ok game for what it is.

DISCLAIMER: i didn't play more than about 20-30 min of this game, it could just be because it's not my type of game, you might end up enjoying it, and i would definetly recommend you try it before judging it.

Also. Have a nice day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294101193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1556118955}
review:
[h1] Отличный симулятор смертей [/h1]

Приготовьтесь сохраняться почти каждое своё действие:
[list]
[*] Прилёг? Умер
[*] Помог человеку? Умер
[*] Вздохнул? Умер
[/list]

Тем не менее, это придаёт игре атмосферу того самого хоррора, а вместе с этими стрёмными изображениями — вы получаете отличную новеллу, для чтения ночью.

Почти каждое изображение какого-то монстра сопровождается музыкой, которая заставлят вас ещё больше бояться происходящего!

А история... Чтож, она вполне хороша, да и сама игра заставит вас хоть немного, да пошевелить мозгами.

[b] В целом, годный визуальный роман, который можно пройти на одном дыхании. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198029075979', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1553800580}
review:
[h1] A somewhat abstract, trial-and-error horror VN about a mysterious disease-like darkness that plagues the land. Short-ish and fully wrapped up in spooky, depressing vibes and visuals.[/h1]

-> Monochrome visuals that aren't too spooky, but they do give a slight thrill in a non-jumpscare sort of way.

-> Fun/thrilling deaths that reward you with funny achievements. 

-> Multiple save slots for your convenience.

-> Many routes (albeit usually short, ending in death).

-> Somewhat short playthrough.

-> Exploring rewards/punishes you, so I'd recommend utilizing more than one save slot. >1 save slot also really helps with gathering achievements.

-> There is a walkthrough on Steam for this game, an "auto" feature, and a "skip" feature, so if you want to backtrack that way or blaze through achievements, you are able to.

[i]Edited for formatting purposes.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198418549470', 'num_games_owned': 1157, 'num_reviews': 654, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1553037011}
review:
Lot to like about Disturbed, but the gameplay was not for me at all. It is a no cost game, so might as well try it.

You repeatedly reload your game, after every two or three choice selections. Typical gameplay action looks like: "Choose door A, door B, or door C ?"...choose door A... die!... reload... choose door B... die!... reload... choose door C... "Okay. Now, do you choose path A, path B, or path C ?"

Meanwhile, there is some really great artwork and decent sound effects. The narrative writing was totally solid. This could have been a very decent point and click adventure game, had they bothered with an inventory system. In fact, the game reminded me of the classic Shadowgate in many ways.

I tried this game on ubuntu linux 18.10, with radeon mesa graphic drivers. The game had a 180 MB install size. The game is played with the mouse controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339531784', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1667527355}
review:
Пугающая атмосфера. Такая, серая и мрачная...Туман добавляет загадочности. Пустота и безысходность. А когда тумана много становится...страшней? Так же и с тьмой. Просто, в один момент наступает такое время когда ты не знаешь чего ожидать от игры. Что-то вроде: "А вдруг пока ты будешь идти по тёмному подземелью, ты выйдешь на собственную гибель"? Стены обрушатся? Вылезет какой-нибудь страшный чертила с сопровождающим его звуком? [spoiler] Снова та не приятная сцена с дышащим, разлагающимся человеком? [/spoiler]
Музыка напрягающая. Такое чувство будто сейчас произойдёт какой-то п****ц.

В общем, в самый раз что-бы поиграть в час ночи. Особенно людям со слабой психикой и впечатлительным.
[spoiler] И не уснуть больше н***й никогда. [/spoiler]

Но по мимо хоррорности, здесь есть интересный сюжет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314503217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1550239276}
review:
De cómo un granjero sueña que erradica la peste reinante en su tierra. 
No es una gran historia pero entretiene. Ambientacion buena.
Hay multiples caminos para seguir, los cuales te llevan a diversas formas de morir. solo hay un final feliz.
Al principio parece muy tonto, pero encontrar el camino correcto se vuelve un tanto complicado.
Es indie, F2P, es un juego corto. No te lleva más de dos horas terminarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355525302', 'num_games_owned': 872, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1588678558}
review: В принципе мне понравилось. Я даже выбил почти все дpoчивки — значит, помер большинством возможных смертей в этом симуляторе погибания. Рисунки простенькие, анимация тоже, звуковое сопровождение бедное, сюжет незамысловат (я бы сказал, почти отсутствует), но минут 40 за счёт моей природной склонности исследовать всё досконально мне было интересно. А бросил я из-за нелогичности передвижения: залез глубоко — нельзя вернуться. Захотел повернуть назад — нельзя. Придётся залезть в дебри и нарезать круги в попытке  прийти туда, откуда начал. Откатывать сохранения при этом не вариант, потому что по ходу дела герой разживается необходимыми предметами. Плюс комбинацию на открытие дерева самому подобрать нереально: 3 кнопки, которые если каждую можно набирать только один раз, то 9 комбинаций, если по нескольку раз, то неограниченное число комбинаций. При этом ни подсказок, ни зацепок игра не даёт. Подсмотрел в гайде. В общем, сносный аскетичный квест, но недоработан и потому осваивать его надоедает быстро: не хочется e6ать себе голову не из-за того, что ты тупишь и что-то упустил, а потому что что-то упустил разработчик.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140510738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1547737807}
review:
Title checks out. I am indeed Disturbed.

The first few minutes seem to be an experiment in how many creepy death scenes a player will sit through, but if you stick it out there is in fact a storyline with a goal that your actions make progress towards. Do save often, though, as the sudden deaths continue throughout the game.

review: I enjoyed this very much. I was put off at first by the graphics, but then began to love them for this style of game. I had fun discoverig all the various ways you can meet your demise, as you can tell I did 100% on this. It is a free game and worth the play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078815095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1547093824}
review:
Disturbed is a free choose your own [strike]adventure[/strike] death visual novel. It is very easy to die, in fact there are 16 different ways, and mildly annoying to win.

It could use some editting, but there isn't anything which will make you tear out your eyes.

While I personally don't like the art style, it is well done and completely fitting for the setting.

My only real complaint is navigating the world. In order to get the good end, you need to do a LOT of going back and forth. It would greatly benefit from fast traveling. 

That being said, its a solid example of a free horror visual novel and worth playing if you are a fan of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802005602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1544729732}
review:
J'ai passer un très bon moment devant ce jeu et j'ai été très triste de voir que je n'avais plus de mort à découvrir au bout d'un moment. Sans blague, on peut mourir à presque tous les tableaux. 
Concernant l'histoire (car on joue principalement pour ça) elle est très bien, très prenante même si j'avoue qu'au début, j'ai eu du mal à accrocher. Tout n'est pas expliquer (ce qui est vachement dommage) et cela m'a laissé un peu sur ma faim. Je crois que Disturbed : Beyond Aramor nous permettra d'explorer l'univers plus en profondeur mais il n'y a malheureusemenpas de vf :'( du moins, pour l'instant
En tout cas, c'est un très bon jeu qui, certes, ne dure pas longtemps mais qui est très agréable

author: {'steamid': '76561198149017561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1548041409}
review:
Rather have a neutral option. Disturbed is an okay visual novel.

The Good: Wide variety of selections to choose from. You're rewarded for simply dying. It's free.
The Bad: It's extremely short. There's really no actual explination that I could see why it went from a productive farm to a wasteland. Some deaths are nonsensical. Some could be improved upon instead of majority being "You died a very painful death". 
The Ugly: Finding the combination to the tree puzzle. There was no clues for the answer. The only option was to brute force it or do what I did: looked at the Community Guides.

Do I recommend it? Yes and no. If you're looking for a cheap way to pass time, then this is for you. If you're looking for complex storyline and characters, this is definately not for you. You will likely find it boring. I would like to see it expaned upon however.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303993330', 'num_games_owned': 1425, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1503598613}
review:
Disturbed feels exactly like the name suggests, with eerie and disturbing storytelling complete with gritty black and white imagery to match. It calls itself an interactive story, similar to a choose your own adventure mixed with a visual novel. You'll die, over and over until you finally find your way through the ending. It's downright creepy at times, with twists and turns in the story that take you from being a farmer to being part of a bigger fantastical story. 

The storyline itself puts you in the shoes of a small village farmer, who sets out in hopes of bringing his farm back to life. Where you start is far from where you end, be it dying to any of the supernatural creatures you encounter or accidentally falling into a well. Finding the true ending involves fully accepting the supernatural and fantasy-like world you walk into and seeking help to aid both you and your farm from the forces greater than your human self. It's a wildly interesting turn for the story to take, but it feels amazing to explore and read through.

I first played Disturbed a while ago (and am only reviewing it now because I forgot to review it back then), and since playing it I haven't found a visual novel-like game much like this one. The most important unique factor is that it plays like a visual novel, but you can pick where you go and backtrack anywhere you'd like. This has a large part of the story, as you need to go back and forth unlocking areas and collecting items to use. It's a very well made concept that I could see lots of other visual novel-like games being able to impliment well. 

The art style is very grungey and fits the theme of this story and all its disturbing written imagery. The hand drawn look it has is both very well done and gives it a creepier vibe than it would have with top of the line CG art. It reminds me of older flash-based choose your own adventure games that were popular in the early 00's, and carries that hint of nostalgia with it for anyone who used to scare themselves as a child with those games.

Disturbed is a short, free game that has a lot to offer if you like visual novels and choose your own adventure games. For what it's worth it's very well made and highly engaging, giving you a mystery to unravel and many different ways to explore. I'd highly recommend playing through the hour or so it takes to find all the endings, and experiencing this story for yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044956333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1538958657}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054705628', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1538877687}
review:
Disturbed is a well crafted point and click game with humor and dark themes.

A short but satisfying story that will make you look through every nook and cranny to find all the different ways to end your adventure.

The ragged almost scetchbook artstyle is beautiful and every screen is unique and cool to look at.

It's free so try it when you get the time.

Pleasant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003306969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1538687264}
review:
absolutely loved this. puzzles were nice, no crazy cliche horror stuff.
and most of all I like that if you think logicaly you get through. No dumb luck or trial and error like some other horror or choice games. Had quite a bit of fun with it even though it was kind of on the short side.
if you're wanting more of this and wondering if the DLC is worth it, If it's like the base game then i'd say it's well worth it. I'll likely get it soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329582210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1538684786}
review:
Гра підкупає своєю моторошністю, музикою, звуком і мінмалізмом в історії. Дуже атмосферна річ!

Водночас, я не міг не помітити, що загальна історія є, можливо, знадто простою та не дає відповідней на всі запитання. Якийсь дивний перехід від тотальної безнадії до історій про макгаффіни та порятунок світу. 

Геймплейно, загалом, задовольняло, але спочатку дуже сильно дратувало, що гра нагадувала радше симулятор помирання. Деякі смерті взагалі як сніг посеред ясного неба падали персонажу на голову.

Ну й солов'їний переклад нормальний. У деяких місцях я відчував його неорганічність, а деякі важливі опції, як "decline" (відмовити) якогось дідька перекладаються як "схилитися". Кртш, відчизняному перекладу ігор без фак-апів поки що нікуди.

У будь-якому разі, гра дуже файна "і головне - безкоштовно"!

author: {'steamid': '76561198860036919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1538393691}
review:
Hard to choose whether to categorise it as "recommend" or not.

This dark-fantasy visual novel is absolutely fantastic at setting the eerie atmosphere with its monochrome graphics and seemlessly mixed sounds and effects.  The premise is simple and solid, but the game itself becomes a bit tedious as you backtrack to and fro, literally cycling through familiar images and blocks of text to get from one area to another.  

As others who chose to "not recommend" this game have also said, there is little logic or foreshadowing of choice outcomes and deaths.  You simply pick an option, suddenly die more often than not (and getting an Achievement), and have to remember to not do that next time.  Having to load so often becomes a bit irritating, and even though you can skip through text, it gets to a point where you're just loading the game, skipping text to the choice that killed you last time, and trying to not get killed too soon again.  For me, after hitting more than half the Achievements, I started losing interest in the story.

A small sound effect is the only feedback that you get for doing something significant (eg. pick up a key item).  Too bad there is no way to check inventory or anything like that in-game.  In the end, after achieving pretty much all the deaths, I didn't have the time and patience anymore to finish the two "proper" endings without resorting to a guide.

A decently-made free game if you have time to kill, are not fussed about a small-scope game, and are feeling patient enough to read carefully and save/load often.  Not great for those like me wanting a faster-paced, positive-reward game, or people who (even with free games) generally prefer not to be left feeling frustrated while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008621908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1537239965}

author: {'steamid': '76561198139181347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1537187553}
review:
Wozu Stellt man die Sprache ein beim Starten wenn sie beim Spielende wieder auf Englsich steht ? 
solche Einfachen Einstellungen Speichert jedes kleinste Spiel nur das nicht.
Dazu hängt es gerne und man mu mit Affenkralle raus.
Texte unzusammenhängend und Wirr. hat das jemand Geschrieben während eines Aufenthaltes in einer Balla Balla Klinik ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198022391714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1604184071}
review:
This dark point and click adventure is the story of a farmer in the cursed and dying land of Aramor, you choose what he must done in order to save his failing farm. It really reminds me of the choose your adventure books when I was a child, I think this is a good update on the genre .
I do like the new dlc to celebrate 4 years, its adds and extra dimension to the game and certainly gave me a spook the first time I saw it. It certainly kept the game fresh for me on my replay, though I can see it ramping up the difficulty a bit too much for people who are new to the game.

The puzzles are logical and fairly straight forward, does require a bit of back and forth movements to complete the tasks. As you would expect of a horror game, you will die and die a lot - there are a variety of brutal deaths you can experience and I will give credit for the creativity.
In terms of world building and story, there is not a lot there which can either add to the mystery surrounding the world or can be boring depending on what you are looking for in a game. It is a very linear plot and it means the ending of the game is a bit dissatisfying, as it feels a bit of a rushed ending due to all the holes.

The art is perfect for such a dark world; it is stylistic, black and grey work, and it certainly builds the horrific world we are stepping into.
The music is both beautiful and slightly haunting, really helps create an atmosphere of despair and loss within the world, whist the ethereal quality gives the impression of the farmer's faint hope things will change. The soft background music builds an unsettling atmosphere and allows the main sound effects to drive the eerie ambience.

Overall it is a short game, for the brilliant price of free. It is certainly worth a go if you want to try something different in your point and click horror games, and are not expecting much in terms of story and world building.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010597228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1532712969}
review:
Kurzes, aber interessantes Spiel.
Sehr abstrakt und verworren, aber einem roten Faden folgend, den man nur verlässt wenn man dem richtige Weg nicht folgt und so automatisch in den Tod geht!
Dabei sind die meisten Tode vermeidbar, bringen jedoch immer eine Errungenschaft mit sich, weshalb man sie auch sucht, um das Spiel so gänzlich zu erleben.
Der Pilz wird aufgehoben, die Höhle wird durchsucht, man legt sich in sein bett und schläft... Gerade am Anfang sind diese Tode vermeidbar, wenn man nicht sterben mag, später jedoch geht man nur durch eine Tür und hat schon verloren. Da wäre eine Möglichkeit dem zu entgehen noch schön gewesen, aber trotzdem hat es Spaß gemacht!

Fazit: Kostenlos und gut :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198105156704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1479917417}
review:
This game was a lot of nostalgic fun. Its a dark fantasy choice driven visual novel, but very reminiscent in atmosphere and the way it's presented of the old text based adventure games with static monochrome images . 

Your choices do have an impact and there are several endings ranging from good to, bad, serious to  fun . Reaching the various endings is a bit trial and error,  and you can die, but not to the point of it becoming annoying (and you can have  several saves). 
 
This game also has achievements, and its free!  Well worth checking out for adventure fans as well as those who like visual novels

author: {'steamid': '76561197968312284', 'num_games_owned': 2395, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1531996507}
review:
Disturbed is a short visual novel with a dark theme and (imo) very well done hand drawn visuals. 

You get offered a lot of different choices, which often enough will lead to your immediate death (and "reward" you with achievements) 
It's not a horror game and there are no jumpscares - nevertheless it was an enjoyable hour of playtime.

I liked the art style and the overall athmosphere, although I wouldn't mind a bit more of ambience sounds / music.

As it's free you can't go wrong giving it a shot, if you don't mind playing visual novels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219098024', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1531822258}
review:
В те далёкие времена, когда Нолан ещё не родился и космические корабли не бороздили просторы Большого театра, природа ополчилась против человечества.  В который, мать вашу за ногу, раз.
Однажды ранним погожим утром, наш ГГ, обнаружил, что корова сдохла, а жена повесилась.
 - Эх, корову жалко. Подумал ГГ. И отправился куда глаза глядят, а глядели они к слову, в сторону местного трактира.  Трактир представлял из себя, добротное строение из брёвен, окружённым садом из хмеля, распространявшего запах пива на всю округу. Чем заставлял мужиков мечтательно думать о вечерней попойке, а их жён беситься от вечно бухих мужей, что спускали все деньги в трактире. Трактиром заправлял одноногий старик лет 65-70, среднего роста и крепкого телосложения, с вечно хмурым лицом и одним своим взглядом, мог утихомирить любую перебравшую компанию. На нём был фартук, возможно его ровесник, но всегда чистый и выглаженный, по всей видимости способствовала этому его внучка, роста метр с кепкой в прыжке со стула, с озорными, смеющимися глазами, достающая своими распросами, странствующих торговцев о местах где им довелось побывать. Путь к трактиру, пролегал через пшеничное поле.
 -Проклятье, порча сожрала все посевы и урожая в этом году не будет. Паршивые дела, что сказать? Тяжело вздохнув, наш герой поплёлся дальше. Обычно в трактире царила суматоха с перекликающимся звонким смехом маленькой хозяйки, но сейчас, в свете недавних событий, здесь царила гнетущая тишина. 
- Здрав будь хозяин, здрав, будь хозяйка. 
-И тебе не хворать, коль не шутишь. Отозвался старик из тёмного угла.
Когда все сбежали, старик остался, не хотел покидать место, которому отдал столько сил. А его внучка, не хотела оставлять старика одного.
- Ну, что старик скажешь, что делать то будем? Корова сдохла, жена повесилась.
- Ты главное русалку не еби, а то останемся без местной достопримечательности.
-Что?
- Ничего, мысли вслух. Короче, слух сюды. Нолан ещё не родился, Илон Маск тоже. Червоточин не придумали, а значит...
-Что? Что за бред?
- Я не хочу выслушивать слова про бред, от человека, разговаривающего с пнём. Парень, у тебя галлюцинации от голода. Поэтому заткнись и слушай.  
Сейчас [spoiler] Идёшь по тропинке, берёшь в повозке ключ, идёшь дальше, в пещеру только не заходи, подходишь к башне, там дерево, в дереве три кнопки (первая, два раза третья) идёшь в правую пещеру, находишь корабль, там нож. идёшь в среднюю пещеру, там направо, цветок. Идёшь в левую, там верёвка, идёшь назад на улицу, идёшь по тропинке, находишь проклятый меч, возвращаешься за цветком  [/spoiler] 
- Стой, а зачем ты говоришь чёрными полосками, я же не понимаю ничерта.
- Идиот. Катька, заводи харлей, мы сваливаем. А тебе, сдохнуть 16 раз. что символично. Дрын дын дын дын. РРРРРРРРРРР.
- Приснится же всякая хрень, какая милая пещерка, а что там внутри?...

author: {'steamid': '76561198399316997', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1531786692}

author: {'steamid': '76561198056536414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1559944294}
review:
Ce jeu est une expérience merveilleuse et lugubre, il n'y a pas de musique, donc ça dépend uniquement des graphismes sombres, et des sons atmosphériques pour ses aspects d'horreur. Ses graphismes dessinés à la main sont merveilleusement insérés, ajoutant beaucoup au jeu. Dans l'ensemble, je crois que Disturbed est un bon jeu Chasseur de succès... Aucune carte de collection n’est offerte, 17 succès très difficilement gagnés (même avec le guide). Je le recommande fortement.  Après tout c'est gratuit. :))

Amicalement
Le pasteur

author: {'steamid': '76561197986156553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1530650515}
review: Es muy corto y me recuerda a shadowgate (pero vamos es bastante más fácil que la dificultad "normal" de este último). No veo que lo haya puesto nadie, pero si tiene "final" y aunque tiene varias formas de morir, muchas son predecibles si conoces el género o solo lo harás por "prueba y sigue". Es gratuito y aunque tiene ciertos errores en el doblaje en algunas partes (todavía en inglés), y a aparte mientras que el protagonista recoge objetos, no tienes un inventario visible por lo que para recordar lo que tienes, hay que tirar de la memoria, además de por las zonas laberínticas (aunque no al nivel de aventuras gráficas famosas a lo monkey island), pero tampoco eso lo hace injugable. Un 5.5 y un nivel "un poco" más alto que un juego de newgrounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045136299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1530447591}
review: Disturbed is a short 'Choose Your Own Adventure' style visual novel. Your goal is to progress through the story by (hopefully) picking the paths that won't lead to your untimely demise. But for many - thanks to the achievements - it becomes as much about discovering the many ways /to/ die as it does about finding that path. And for that (and the fact that it's free (and there's no neutral option)), I'm recommending it. Otherwise...it is pretty simple. (Also, I don't know how it came to be on my list..)

author: {'steamid': '76561198176743631', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1530487865}
review: For free, or even for 99 cents it's an enjoyable way to spend roughly an hour. Honestly, it felt more like a dark comedy game than a horror game. You will die. A lot. Save often if you feel you're doing well, cause it gets a bit tedious to repeat the beginning. I hope to see more by this developer, maybe a longer game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198052802708', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1530200802}
review:
[i]The invisible worm,
That flies in the night
In the howling storm,

Has found out thy bed
Of crimson joy;
~William Blake[/i]

Disturbed is a free visual novel with complex branching narratives focusing on a young farm boy who sets out to discover what is plaguing his farmlands and discovers his own mortality.

[h1] Gameplay[/h1]
Disturbed has a simple choice system that works by clicking upon the choice you wish to make. Then proceeds further by presenting you with a new screen, with accompanying illustration, text and choice. The plethora of choices is what makes the game unique and it allows for backtracking and encourages pursuit of multiple paths. Built on the ren.py system there are also options to save and load directly within the game allowing you to change your decisions on the fly and ensure you don’t lose too much progress. 
The game relies heavily not only on your own ability to save with discretion but on your ability to memorize choices that could cause death.  However once certain objectives are fulfilled some obstacles are able to be overcome, such as obtaining a flower allows you to break the curse on a sword and therefore not die when you take it. These objectives take the form of items and give added options, depending on the order in which you pursue them.
This flexibility within the text itself lends itself well to the trial and error gameplay. 

[h1] Narrative[/h1]
Disturbed is very much a homage to traditional sword and sorcery fantasy. It gives nods and winks to various famous events in general fantasy literature, and exhibits a macabre black humour. 
The game begins simply with the standard farm boy, but unlike the Rand Al’Thor’s of the grand fantasy adventures, the protagonist (or rather you the player) are bewildered, incompetent and very much in the dark. This is where the brilliance of the simple approach shines through but this simplicity belies the complexity of the branching narratives… It is very much a game that encourages the player to write their own twisted tales of death. And the game does celebrate its sadistic premise. You will be curious to find out what seemingly harmless scenario might result in your death. The complicity between the writers of the game and you the player, in exploring scenarios that might generate your demise becomes an intriguing activity and the macabre premise results in a strange sense of humour.
The world itself is also simple, a reflection it feel s of the protagonists mind, and yet there are odd depths to be explored. Not only are you given the writing across the screen but also other sources of information within the game, by speaking to an npc, or reading materials in the world, that gives more insight into the situation you find yourself in. The protagonist as a blank slate, has no motivations other than what you the played decide, in a way this situation lends itself as by not fully identifying or empathizing with the character you feel compelled to send him to his death… something that is truly disturbing.
There is nothing beautiful within the writing, it is plain and simple as indicative of the uneducated protagonist you play. The world itself also reflects this in its way. There are indications of various fantasy tropes (or archetypes) that lend credulity to the world, yet it never truly manifests itself even as you explore the labyrinth of choices that confront you. The world is the danger, and its straightforward portrayal actually lends itself to the labyrinth of choices that confront you. In this way the game foregrounds not its writing but your own ability to drive the narrative forward.

[h1] Graphics[/h1]
Disturbed has a clearly chosen aesthetic, that lends itself well to the overall experience, the twisted drawings that appear to be muddied charcoal on paper, lend themselves to the mysteriousness of the world that confronts you. Monsters and humans appear distorted and unreal, and enhanced by the blurred outline of the lines. 
However as much as this lends itself to the tone of the game, the display options are problematic. Firstly it is difficult to set contrast. The backgrounds and grey tones don’t filter very well when you attempt to adjust a screen or monitors display. In addition the lack of support for various resolutions leads to an unimpressive display on higher resolution screens or larger monitors (The game has only it’s native 800x600). 

 [h1] Music and Sound[/h1]
The title screen greets you with the harsh sound of a winter wind…and an organ wailing above it. It’s gothic and strange and prepares you for the upcoming adventure and then as you enter the game. Silence. There is no music; only vague sound effects that accompany your choices, be it the creaking of hinges as you open and old door, or the rustle of dried pages as you read a journal. And finally a distorted violin sounds as you encounter your death.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
Disturbed suffers from some poor options for optimization but behind the odd display and simplistic fonts lies an adventure just as sadistic as the title promises, that revels in its own blend of black humour.

Recommended to: People who enjoy choice and consequences gaming and complex branching narratives
Not recommended to: People who don’t like visual novels in general

author: {'steamid': '76561198098257938', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1530446984}
review:
[h1]Долина смертной тени[/h1]

Прошёл трижды: осенью 16-го, когда она только вышла, затем весной 17-го, когда появилась возможность поддержать разработчика рублём, и, сейчас, решив освежить память перед сиквелом. Очень депрессивная по атмосфере визуальная новелла про фермера, который однажды столкнулся лицом перед страшной чумой, охватившей его родные земли. Как говорится - лёжа дел не сделаешь, а посему он отправляется в долгий, полный опасностей путь. 

Как я узнал чуть позже, игра была создана единственным разработчиком, который находился в тяжёлой депрессии. И единственным выходом для него стали наброски карандашом на белых листах бумаги, через которые он хотел показать своё душевное состояние. Таким образом и зародился данный проект. Главной особенностью является не только стиль в чёрно-белых тонах, её атмосфера безысходности и крупицы надежды, а кол-во смертей, с которыми может столкнуться игрок. Гибель поджидает за каждым углом и только человек, несущий в себе свет, сможет пробить окутавшую мир тьму. 

От игры остался доволен. Атмосфера передалась идеально. Почерпнул для себя философские нотки происходящего. Одно из тех произведений, в котором полностью ощущаешь себя главным героем, за которого играешь. Ознакомиться с произведением можно бесплатно, а можно поддержать создателя, купив [b]Support DLC[/b], который заслужил этого. 

[h1]Моя оценка:[/h1] [b]8 из 10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198259414835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1527984997}
review: This game is amazing. It's challenging but not frustrating so long as you follow logical paths. Certain things mut be done in certain orders but figuring out the puzzles are SOOOOOO satisfying. 10/10 would reccommend to a friend and play again. The endings/deaths are creative and intriguing. The black and white color adds to the overall experience very well as well as the sketch-book art style. It's well made and I'm definitely looking forward to playing any other games this developer has to offer. i loved that I could choose to explore territories of my wn choosing without dying at every turn I made. I haven't yet played the sequel but I've no doubt it'll be as beautifully creepy as this experience was. I dislike being scared in general but the lack of jumpscares and excess of creepy was perfectly balanced with the intriguing and delightful moments found within the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097121190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1497976935}
review:
[h1] Disturbed The Virtual Novel - Dark Souls Edition [/h1] 

[i] Disturbed [/i] новелла с весьма гнетущей и мрачной атмосферой, где любой неверный шаг способен тебя убить, даже включая бональное "пойти поспать". Но не смотря на ощущение безысходности, которым веет игра, её маленькое приключение способно принести некоторые краски в её серую историю.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047460864', 'num_games_owned': 3167, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1533501952}
review:
[b]There is an achievement that you get at some point by getting killed by a giant spider and called "Sam doesn't save you in this story". How could I NOT recommend this game ?![/b]

Disturbed is a text adventure kind of Visual Novel that reminds me of the "You Are the Hero" books, except that it's shorter and you'll die a lot more. It takes place in a dark and infected world in which you play as a farmer who wants to keep living from his farm despite the desperate situation.

The hand-drawn artwork is great and there are musics and sound effects to create an horror and a bit more immersive atmosphere. The writing is surprisingly good for a free game. There are many routes to explore ; even if at the beginning you'll have the feeling that there is always an option that kills you and another that allows you to continue, it becomes more interesting the more you play and you will need several runs (or a lot of loading) to solve all the puzzles in order to finish the game one way or another.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1467161248

[b]Pros :[/b]
[list]
    [*]Free to play
    [*]Choose Your Own Adventure
    [*]Awesome artstyle
    [*]Dark and intense atmosphere
    [*]Cool animations
    [*]A lot of paths / exploration
    [*]Good writing
    [*]17 achievements
    [*]A lot of save slots (as many as you'd like)
    [*]Update (July 2018) that improved the visual, added animated images and sounds
    [*]Different endings
[/list]

[b]Cons :[/b]
[list]
    [*]1280x720 resolution (previously 800x600)
    [*]You'll die quite a lot
    [*]It only takes 1.5 - 2 hours to explore everything
    [*]Can be a bit confusing or even illogical
[/list]

Disturbed is a decent game, mostly enjoyable if you're into Choose your own Adventure textbooks / Visual Novels, or simply for achievement hunters. For those who want some more, there's a longer sequel now : [url=store.steampowered.com/app/617620/Disturbed_Beyond_Aramor/]Disturbed: Beyond Aramor[/url].

author: {'steamid': '76561198117843545', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1527345005}
review:
Simple, amusing, interesting. This game is 30% replaying, 20% backtracking and 50% death.
A simple, text-based, choose-your-own-adventure type game that got me quite hooked and quite angry at times.
The artstyle is simplistic yet alluring, and the story is written alright. It won't win an oscar but it'll still get a recommendation from me.

Though to be fair, the game does often boil down to trial-and-error. There's a disturbing lack of logic and clarity in a lot of things and I personally had to look up a guide to make sure I got any mildly positive ending. I'd recommend it if you want to spend a few minutes to hours touching about, but free is exactly the right price for it as far as I am concerned.
